amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for the U.S. Agency for International Development-Child Survival and Health Programs Fund.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 20 printed in the Congressional Record to cut $359 million from the bill's funding for the World Bank. The amount represents the cost of World Bank loans provided to Iran in May. The amendment also adds $290 million for the bill's Child Survival account.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Sherman amendment (A001) Failed by recorded vote: 111 - 312 (Roll no. 380).
